nodes.name: Small Platforms Junction
nodes.note: Represents being at the small platforms above the acid.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Spring Ball, IBJ
strats.note: Spring Ball across the platforms, IBJ to the item, then return.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

requires.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

note: Perform a long diagonal bomb jump from the left door to the solid platforms above the acid.
Touch the item and perform another long diagonal bomb jump back.

strats.name: Full Room Space Jump Through Speed Blocks

requires.notable: Full Room Space Jump Through Speed Blocks

strats.note: The blocks can be broken if you can generate a blue suit using the previous room's runway, and carry it to the blocks by slowing floating down with Space Jump.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph

and.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

note: Cross the room with Spring Ball or a long diagonal bomb jump to the solid platforms above the acid.
Go to the right of the speed blocks before unmorphing and exiting G-mode.

strats.name: Direct G-Mode Morph, Remote Acquire

and.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

note: Cross the room with Spring Ball or a long diagonal bomb jump to the solid platforms above the acid.
IBJ to the item, touch it, and drop back down to the right of the speed blocks before unmorphing and exiting G-mode.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph, Power Bomb the Blocks

and.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

note: Cross the room with Spring Ball or a long diagonal bomb jump to the solid platforms above the acid.
Power Bomb the blocks before unmorphing and exiting G-mode.
strats.devNote: FIXME: There could be a 1->3 or 2->3 and breaks the PB blocks, then uses speed from the left to break the blocks.

strats.name: Direct G-Mode Morph, Power Bomb the Blocks, Remote Acquire

and.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

note: Cross the room with Spring Ball or a long diagonal bomb jump to the solid platforms above the acid.
IBJ to the item, touch it, and drop back down to the right of the speed blocks. Place a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-mode before it explodes to break the blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Mella Ice Clip, Door Lock Skip

and.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

note: Cross the room with Morph, Spring Ball, or a long diagonal bomb jump to the solid platforms above the acid.
It can help to moonwalk towards a Mella that has never been on screen, so that it starts swooping immediately as it first enters the screen.
This will make it so that when Samus is below it, it will always swoop and go up slightly compared to the previous swoop.
Once it is close to the right height, move away so it stops swooping, freeze it and quickly try the clip, if it doesn't work, quickly leave and try again.

strats.name: Full Speed Jump to Missile
strats.note: Jump with enough run speed to reach the wall below the Missile Item Location.

strats.name: Left-Side Enter with Shinespark
strats.note: Takes three walljumps, and must shinespark at the apex.

strats.name: Left-Side Shinespark
strats.note: Takes three walljumps, and must shinespark at the apex.

strats.name: Left-Side Enter with Shinespark and HiJump
strats.note: Walljump or build run speed using the full runway to jump high enough for the shinespark.

strats.name: Left-Side HiJump Shinespark
strats.note: Walljump or build run speed using the full runway to jump high enough for the shinespark.

strats.name: Left Side Diagonal Shinespark
note: Store a shinespark near the left door and use the remaining runway to jump as far as possible to the right.
Once near the acid platforms, Shinespark diagonally to reach the item location.

strats.name: Indiana Jones Grapple
strats.note: Grapple off several Ripper 2.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph

and.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

strats.note: Cross the room with Spring Ball or a long diagonal bomb jump to the solid platforms above the acid, then IBJ to the item.

strats.name: Wall Jump Shinespark to Left Door
strats.note: Fire off the shinespark at the apex of two consecutive walljumps.

strats.name: Big Jump Horizontal Shinespark
note: Charge a spark to the right, then come back, run and jump, and do a horizontal spark at the apex.
If needed, down-grab onto the ledge.

strats.name: Big Jump Diagonal Shinespark
note: Charge a spark to the right a specific distance of about 6 tiles past the broken Speed blocks.
Then turn around, run and jump, and activate a diagonal spark as late as possible.
By shortening the jump, it is possible to kill a Ripper and collect its drop while falling.

strats.name: Leave With Spark (Long Speedy Jump)
note: Store a shinecharge and start running below the left side of the vertical door, to set up the jump in a way that shinesparking at the apex of the jump approximately aligns with the top of the far door.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph

and.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

note: With just Bombs, killing the Mellas can be a bit tricky; it is recommended to use one to boost and place some midair before luring a Mella to more easily kill it.
Then use Spring Ball and an IBJ or a long diagonal IBJ to get to the left.

strats.name: Direct G-Mode Morph, Remote Acquire

and.notable: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump

note: With just Bombs, killing the Mellas can be a bit tricky; it is recommended to use one to boost and place some midair before luring a Mella to more easily kill it.
IBJ to the item, touch it, and use Spring Ball and an IBJ or a long diagonal IBJ to get to the left.

strats.name: Break Speed Blocks, Broken Power Bomb Blocks
Break Speed Blocks, Short Charge
strats.note: Commonly known as a stutter-3, this is also doable as a 4-tap.

strats.name: Mella Ice Clip Door Lock Skip
note: Freeze a Mella at a precise distance below the door in order to crouch-jump up and clip through the door shell.
The pixel window is larger and higher with Morph and an X-Ray stand-up, in which case a standing jump is used.
It can help to moonwalk towards a Mella that has never been on screen, so that it starts swooping immediately as it first enters the screen.
This will make it so that when Samus is below it, it will always swoop and go up slightly compared to the previous swoop.
Once it is close to the right height, move away so it stops swooping, freeze it and quickly try the clip, if it doesn't work, quickly leave and try again.

strats.name: Mella Farm
strats.note: Shoot the Mellas when they first begin to come on screen, and they will not move.

strats.name: Leave with Shinecharge - Power Bomb Blocks Destroyed
note: Get a normal height jump by releasing run with SpeedBooster and no HiJump.
Break spin to reach the transition without a wall jump.

strats.name: Leave with Shinecharge - Power Bomb Blocks Intact
note: Get a normal height jump by releasing run with SpeedBooster and no HiJump.
Break spin to reach the transition without a wall jump.

strats.name: Leave With Platform Below - Basic Platform
Leave With Platform Below - Upper Left Power Bomb Block
devNote: With HiJump this can be used coming up Main Street, the bottom left of Mt. Everest, and The Beach.
We could add other Power Bomb block platforms too (e.g. the lower ones, and on the right side), but they don't yet appear to have any application.

strats.name: Leave With Platform Below - Power Bomb Blocks Broken
Leave With Platform Below - Speed Blocks Broken
devNote: The tile next to the Power Bomb blocks is not counted as part of the jumpway, since using it would cause Samus to bonk.
A tricky jump is required because of the difficulty of avoiding the Power Bomb blocks and still reaching the door.

strats.name: Leave With Platform Below - Power Bomb and Speed Blocks Broken
devNote: This strat is for avoiding the canTrickyJump requirement when jumping left-to-right, if the Power Bomb blocks can be destroyed.
It also makes it possible to gain more speed by running a few tiles further, which is needed for certain strats.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Frozen Mella
note: The easiest way to set up G-mode is to lure a low Mella to the door, take a hit, then jump and aim down and freeze it while it is high enough and still rising.
If the Mella is not moving upwards, there is a good chance that Samus will be in a falling state as she is hit through the transition and can't use X-Ray.
If Samus does not stay on the Mella, she can spin jump or midair morph directly onto the Mella without touching the transition.
It may be worthwhile to keep the other Mellas alive so that on a failed attempt, Samus can freeze the Mella to go farm some of the others in room.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb the Blocks
strats.note: Place a Power Bomb then exit G-Mode to break the blocks.

strats.name: Direct G-Mode Morph, Remote Acquire
note: With just Bombs, killing the Mellas can be a bit tricky; it is recommended to use one to boost and place some midair before luring a Mella to more easily kill it.
IBJ to the item, touch it, and return to the right of the speed blocks before unmorphing and exiting G-mode.

strats.name: Direct G-Mode Morph, Power Bomb the Blocks, Remote Acquire
note: Use a Power Bomb to kill the Mellas and this will break the Power Bomb blocks after exiting G-mode.
IBJ to the item, touch it, and return to the right of the speed blocks before unmorphing and exiting G-mode.

strats.name: G-Mode Mella Ice Clip, Door Lock Skip
note: It can help to moonwalk towards a Mella that has never been on screen, so that it starts swooping immediately as it first enters the screen.
This will make it so that when Samus is below it, it will always swoop and go up slightly compared to the previous swoop.
Once it is close to the right height, move away so it stops swooping, freeze it and quickly try the clip, if it doesn't work, quickly leave and try again.
strats.devNote: This is only for indirect G-Mode, because it is trivial while in direct, and would use a different strat.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: With just Bombs, killing the Mellas can be a bit tricky; it is recommended to use one to boost and place some midair before luring a Mella to more easily kill it.

strats.name: Full Shinespark
strats.note: Spark from the ground, left of the Power Bomb blocks.

strats.name: Shinespark Ends Over Acid
strats.note: Spark from the ground, left of the Power Bomb blocks.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit
strats.note: Use a flash suit to spark horizontally through the speed blocks. Samus may stop above the acid, but it should always be possible to land on one of the platforms.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: A single horizontal Power Bomb boost can get Samus on top of the blocks and kill most of the Mellas.
With Bombs, killing the Mellas can be a bit tricky; it is recommended to use one to boost and place some midair before luring a Mella to more easily kill it.

strats.name: Indiana Jones Grapple in Reverse
strats.note: Involves grappling off several Ripper 2.

strats.name: Speedjump
strats.note: Run on the moving platform (Kamer).

strats.name: Spring Ball Unmorph Bomb Boost
note: Use an unmorph bomb boost at the end of a mid-air SpringBall jump.
Also requires a crouch-jump and down-grab to complete the maneuver.
A spring fling can help add some lenience to the bomb placement and unmorph timing;
it requires pausing early, before jumping, in order to be able to initiate another pause immediately before placing a Power Bomb.

strats.name: Frozen Mella Door
note: Lure a Mella from the right by breaking the speed blocks or using Morph.
Then you need to manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit
strats.note: Jump back from the leftmost floating platform and diagonally shinespark at the peak of the jump towards the door to minimize shinespark damage.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Mella
note: Lure a Mella from the right by breaking the speed blocks or using Morph.
Then manipulate it to go high enough to be used in the left doorway.
Raise the Mella up to just below the door's ledge and then climb up to the door.
Reposition the Mella once towards the door, and before it finishes moving, stand in the doorframe so that the next Mella movement will hit Samus.
If it drops below the camera it will be necessary to go back down and raise it again.

strats.name: Acid Shinespark
strats.note: Gravity makes it possible to charge a spark in the acid in order to break the speed blocks.

strats.name: Break Speed Blocks, Insane Short Charge
strats.note: Commonly known as a stutter-3, this is also doable as a 4-tap.

strats.name: Springwall
note: A particularly precise springwall.
Aim the walljump at the bottom of the second sloped wall fixture, where it looks like you cant jump off of.
Optimize pause timing, use an instant morph, and get a max height springball jump. A delayed wall jump helps.

strats.name: Indy Jones Short Mella
note: Lure a Mella from the right by breaking the speed blocks or using Morph.
Then you need to manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.

strats.name: Indy Jones Long Mella
note: Lure a Mella from the right by breaking the speed blocks or using Morph.
Then manipulate it to go high enough to be used as a stepping stone once frozen.
Without movement items it may be necessary to continue manipulating it from above, jumping and aiming down to freeze it.

strats.name: Mella Ice Clip
note: Freeze the Mella at a precise location in order to jump through the crumble block, then wall jump up the long channel and mid-air morph to get out.
One normalized way to do this: Kill the first two Mellas, moonwalk to the right until the third Mella just barely goes off-camera,
fire a shot, and move left to scroll the Mella back on-camera just before the shot would despawn, in order to freeze it at a specific height.
While it is frozen, kill the remaining Mellas, and press against the wall of Speed blocks.
Perform an action that changes Samus' pose (e.g., press an angle button, jump, or crouch/uncrouch) in order to be able to moonwalk from that position.
Moonwalk backwards 5 pixels, then jump straight up, and continue holding jump while pressing right, to perform a buffered turn-around spin jump to the right.
If executed correctly, the Mella will move horizontally left and will be at a good height to be able to freeze and clip through the crumble block with a crouch jump.
Get on top of the Mella with a mid-air morph, position under the crumble block, then unmorph for the crouch jump.
Quickly spin-jump to re-enter the shaft after breaking the crumble block.
Tip: if Samus moonwalks back further than 5 pixels, press against the Speed blocks again before trying to moonwalk back again, to avoid possibly getting bad subpixels.
devNote: The manipulation can also work with moonwalking back between 6 and 10 pixels, but depending on the exact position the bug may move at a shallow angle rather than exactly horizontally;
in this case, the bug should be frozen a bit early (i.e. further right), to ensure it does not re-enter its idle animation where its height would become unpredictable.
FIXME: Investigate if there is a normalized setup for freezing in the high-pixel position.
FIXME: A freestyle version (or alternative normalized setup?) of the strat could be added, to avoid the canMoonwalk requirement, using X-Ray or a very precise freeze to get up.

notables.name: Indiana Jones Grapple
notables.note: Involves grappling off several Rippers, where falling may lead to a soft lock.

notables.name: G-Mode Morph Long Diagonal Bomb Jump
notables.note: Perform a long diagonal bomb jump from the left door to the solid platforms above the acid.

notables.name: Full Room Space Jump Through Speed Blocks
notables.note: The blocks can be broken if you can generate a blue suit using the previous room's runway, and carry it to the blocks by slowing floating down with Space Jump.

notables.name: Left Side Diagonal Shinespark
note: Store a shinespark near the left door and use the remaining runway to jump as far as possible to the right.
Once near the acid platforms, Shinespark diagonally to reach the item location.

notables.name: Big Jump Shinespark
notables.note: Charge a spark to the right, then come back, run and jump, and perform a shinespark (horizontally or diagonally) to reach the ledge.

notables.name: Acid Shinespark
notables.note: Gravity makes it possible to charge a spark in the acid in order to break the speed blocks.

notables.name: Springwall
note: A particularly precise springwall.
Aim the walljump at the bottom of the second sloped wall fixture, where it looks like you cant jump off of.
Optimize pause timing, use an instant morph, and get a max height springball jump. A delayed wall jump helps.

notables.name: Mella Ice Clip
note: Freeze the Mella at a precise location in order to jump through the crumble block, then wall jump up the long channel and mid air morph to get out.

notables.name: Spring Ball Unmorph Bomb Boost
note: Use an unmorph bomb boost at the end of a mid-air SpringBall jump.
Also requires a crouchjump and downgrab to complete the maneuver.
A spring fling can help add some lenience to the bomb placement and unmorph timing;
it requires pausing early before jumping, in order to be able to initiate another pause immediately before placing a Power Bomb.
